Slide-seq dataset

Lukas M. Weber

lukas.weber@jhu.edu
Slide-seq_dataset.Rmd

Leader(s)

Lukas Weber

Difficulty & duration

  • intermediate to advanced
  • tier 1 (dataset): 1-2 days
  • tier 2 (workflow): 1-2 weeks

Abstract

Our aim is to select several examples of spatially resolved transcriptomics datasets from different platforms, format them into SpatialExperiment objects, and collect them in the SpaData package.

SpaData is currently under development on GitHub, and will be submitted to Bioconductor as an ExperimentHub package. These datasets can then be easily loaded by users and developers, e.g. for use in examples, workflow, and tutorials.

Currently, the SpaData package contains the following datasets:

  • Human DLPFC (10x Genomics Visium): One sample of human brain from the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) region, spanning the six cortical layers and white matter. Sourced from our publication Maynard and Collado-Torres et al. 2020.
  • Mouse coronal (10x Genomics Visium): One sample of mouse brain, coronal section, spanning one hemisphere. Sourced from 10x Genomics.

These existing objects are from the 10x Genomics Visium platform. To make the SpaData package and our example workflows more broadly applicable, we would like to add additional datasets from other platforms.

Targets

There are two targets in this challenge. The main target is the Tier 1 target. If there is interest and capacity, we can continue with the Tier 2 target.

Tier 1 target

  • Identify a suitable publicly available dataset from published literature using the Slide-seqV2 platform (Stickels et al. 2020)
  • Download the dataset and format it into a SpatialExperiment object
  • Write a reproducible script for generating the SpatialExperiment object, following the guidelines for ExperimentHub packages
  • Add the object to the SpaData package

Tier 2 target

We are also compiling examples of analysis workflows for each dataset, which will be added to an online textbook under development (Orchestrating Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis with Bioconductor, or OSTA).

If a suitable dataset has been selected under Tier 1, we can continue by writing a complete analysis workflow in RMarkdown format, which can later be added to the OSTA book.
